de.fu.weave.reflect
Class Module<M extends Module>

java.lang.Object
  de.fu.weave.reflect.Module<M>
Type Parameters:
M - The Name of the Class of the Model that this Reflector actually is about. That class MUST implement Module.
public class Module<M extends Module>
extends java.lang.Object

This class is a Reflection-Class and reflects Module.

It offers information about a Module, extracted from its Source and its Annotations.

Since:
Iteration2
Author:
Julian Fleischer

Constructor Detail

Module

public Module(java.lang.Class<M> moduleClass)
       throws ModuleException
The one and only constructor.

It will automatically check the Module that this Reflector will be about for validity, that includes (but is not limited to)

  1. The Module features a proper constructur, that is: a public Constructor like the following: public Constructor(Controller parent)
  2. No Action occurs twice
  3. The Module features a default action (whose name is the empty string)
  4. The Method that is annotated to be the default action is named _default

Parameters:
moduleClass - See above.
Throws:
ModuleException - If the Module itself is invalid
Method Detail

forClass

public static <M extends Module> Module<M> forClass(java.lang.Class<M> clazz)
                                         throws ModuleException
Returns a Reflector for a Module given by its Class instance

Type Parameters:
M - The Classname of the Module a Reflector is to be created for
Parameters:
clazz - The instance of the Class to reflect as a Module (can be retrieved via NameOfModule.class)
Returns:
A new Reflector (instance of this class) reflecting the in Module declared in clazz
Throws:
ModuleException - If the Module itself is invalid
Since:
Iteration2

getAction

public Action<M> getAction(java.lang.String name)
Retrieve information about a certain Action that the reflected Module provides

Parameters:
name - The Name of the Action as it is accessible via Web
Returns:
The Reflector of the Action of null if the Action does not exist

getActions

@XmlCollection(value="actions")
public java.util.Collection<Action<M>> getActions()
Retrieve information about the Actions that the reflected Module provides

Returns:
A Collection of Action Reflectors

getDescription

@XmlAttribute(value="description")
public java.lang.String getDescription()
Retrieves the Description annotated to this Module.

Returns:
A String describing the functionality of the Module.

getHomepage

@XmlAttribute(value="homepage")
public java.lang.String getHomepage()
Retrieves the Homepage-URL annotated to this Module.

Returns:
An URL to the Modules Homepage.

Returns:
The Title of the License

The Name as a String

public java.lang.String getQualifiedName()

The Class Name as a String

The Class Instance of the Module M, where M is the Type Parameter of this Reflector

The Class Instance

getVersion

@XmlAttribute(value="version")
public java.lang.String getVersion()
Retrieves the Version annotated to this Module.

Returns:
The Modules Version as a String.

hasAction

public boolean hasAction(java.lang.String name)
Check if a Module features a certain action.

Parameters:
name - The name of the action (See Action.getName()).
Returns:
true or false - if the module provides the desired action or not

isDatabaseRequired

@XmlAttribute(value="dbRequired")
public boolean isDatabaseRequired()
Retrieve whether the Module requires a Connection to the Database or not

Returns:
true or false

newInstance

public M newInstance(Controller parent)
                             throws java.lang.SecurityException,
                                    java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
Parameters:
parent - A Module always belongs to a Controller, this is that Controller
Returns:
A newly created instance of the Module this Reflector is about
Throws:
java.lang.SecurityException - If the current SecurityContext does not allow loading the class
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - If an Exception inside the newly created Module occurs (something in its constructor goes wrong)
